title: Cushion Cover (Made from Woman's Dress)

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of linen, plain weave; embroidered with silk yarns and gilt-metal-strip-wrapped silk in algerian eye, back, ceylon, chain, detached buttonhole, double running, plaited braid, running, square openwork and stem stitches; couching; woven wheels; lined with linen, plain weave.

medium_display: Linen, plain weave; embroidered with silk yarns and gilt-metal-strip-wrapped silk in Algerian eye, back, ceylon, chain, detached buttonhole, double running, plaited braid, running, square openwork and stem stitches; couching; woven wheels; lined with linen, plain weave
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Chauncey B. Borland

V. Ann Waterman. Surface Pattern Design: A Handbook of How to Create Decorative and Repeat Patterns for Designers and Students (New York: Hastings House Publishers, 1984), p. 83.

Bath, Virgina Churchill, Embroidery Masterworks. Classic pateterns and techniques for contemporary application, Chicago: Henry Regnery Company, 1972, page 33-37.
